entry.title: Make picker 2 data dependent on the selected row of picker 1
entry.content:
It is what I want to achive: whenever a selection is changed in the top UIPicker, the choices in the second UIPicker will change accordingly.

Useful lessons from this exercise:

  • The use of API reloadAllComponents
  • The use of class extension and category
  • Identification of the UI object – apparently a == is sufficient to find out which picker instance a picker API is handling

entry.title: swap convention
entry.content:
Floating-rate payer: pay 6-month LIBOR
                     receive a fixed rate of 5.19 percent

Fixed-rate payer: pay a fixed rate of 5.25 percent
                  receive 6-month LIBOR

In this example, the bank is quoting an offer rate of 5.25 percent, which is what the fixed-rate payer will pay, and a bid rate of 5.19 percent, which is what the floating-rate payer will receive. The bid-offer spread is therefore 6 basis points.

from ‘Moorad Choudhry – Fixed Income Securities and Derivatives Handbook (Analysis and Valuation)’

entry.title: conda and ipython
entry.content:
It is a follow-up on my last ipython install issue

Turn out i just need to follow the suggested solution in the conda failure message, which is to use -p /path/to/local/conda

Now I have four set of python runtime installed on my MBP:

  • From Apple

  • From Homebrew

  • From Pythonbrew

  • From conda

entry.title: User defined runtime attribute
entry.content:
It is for the interface builder and xib files to set an attribute in a class.

If the attribute is not defined, you will get this error and the app will crash

this class is not key value coding-compliant for the key <KEYNAME>.'

entry.title: conda install ipython problem
entry.content: How can I update pip? Need research…

entry.title: Finally firefox is built
entry.content: It took almost 10 hours to build in a VM instance of Ubuntu desktop 13.10 with 4GB RAM and 1 CPU

entry.title: Fixing qt4 dependency of pyqt4
entry.content:
SIP is installed

PyQt needs qt4. brew install qt4 takes care of this dependency.

PyQt cannot be installed by either easy_install or pip. I have to download the package, run configure.py and then make and make install

entry.title: Mach problem: Failed at Unified_cpp_2
entry.content:
Failed at this point

Could be due to a change I made earlier related to autoconf in client.mk. In order to do a clean build I will

When I ran hg pull I got this error message:

$ hg pull -u
abort: repository default not found!

Fixed it by creating a .hg/hgrc file:

Unfortunately it does not fix my problem .

It turns out it has something to do with the PC. I created an instance of VirtualBox to run ubuntu desktop 13.10 for the compilation. I only allocted 512MB RAM for the exercise. The failure above is a problem of too little RAM.

Allocated 4GB of RAM to the VM and the exception is gone.

entry.title: Mach problem: Could not compile basic X program
entry.content:
Here is the full error message:

Solution: sudo apt-get install libxt-dev

entry.title: Mach problem: gstreamer backend
entry.content:
This is the full error message:

Solution: sudo apt-get install -y libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev

entry.title: Mach problem: Library requirements (gtk+-2.0 >= 2.10.0 gtk+-unix-print-2.0 glib-2.0 gobject-2.0 gdk-x11-2.0) not met
entry.content:
Full error message:

Solution: sudo apt-get install libgtk2.0-dev

entry.title: Mach problem: C++ compiler cannot create executables
entry.content:
Got this error when I ran mach build:

Solution: install g++

entry.title: mach problem
entry.content:
it comes from this check of mozilla-central/client.mk

The autoconf in the Ubuntu desktop system is of version 2.69. It is clearly not compatible.

Solution: install autoconf-2.13

entry.title: ownership rule exception
entry.content:
Normally an observer or a delegate owner should not hold a strong reference to a callback or a delegate.

The two well-known exceptions are: an NSURLConnection ownes its delegate while the connection is running, and an NSTimer ownes its target while the timer is valid

entry.title: Need to write a proper unit test in objective-c
entry.content:
It is my first attempt at testing my JSON handling code:

Needless to say it is pretty bad, for the following reasons:

  • It has an external dependency of a local server. It is strictly speaking not a unit test

  • The code does not work. It is likely because the run loop is not started when the unit test runs

My TODO:

  • Refactor the above code to be a proper unit test

  • Use functional testing framework to implement the above test

entry.title: Using NSURLConnection to read json data
entry.content:
My code is not good at all for the following reasons:

  • The NSURLConnection retrieves data synchronously

  • The decoding of JSON is not neat. A strong code smell

Synchronous network call

Next step: rewrite the below code to asynchronous mode.

In the viewDidLoad method of my ViewController, I called the following method:

Decoding of JSON data

I used a lot of enumerators to walk through dictionaries and arrays at different level. It makes future changes to the JSON schema or objective-c object model difficult.
